title: 세계의 도시들 비교하기
description: 세계 여러 도시들을 비교하는 글을 읽고 이해합니다.

passage.text:
The world has many amazing cities, each with its own unique features. Let me compare some of the most famous ones.

Tokyo, Japan is one of the largest cities in the world. It has more than 37 million people in its metropolitan area. Tokyo is more modern than many other Asian cities, with the latest technology everywhere. However, it's also more expensive than most cities. A simple meal can cost more than $15!

New York City, USA is often called "The City That Never Sleeps." It's not as large as Tokyo, but it's more diverse. You can find people from almost every country in the world living there. New York has some of the tallest buildings in the world. The Empire State Building was once the tallest building globally, but now there are many taller buildings in other cities.

Paris, France is considered one of the most beautiful cities in the world. It's smaller than Tokyo and New York, but it's more romantic. Paris is famous for its art, food, and culture. Many people think French food is the best in the world. The Eiffel Tower is one of the most visited monuments on Earth.

London, England has a longer history than most modern cities. It's older than New York and has more historical buildings. London is rainier than Paris, but it's also greener, with many beautiful parks. The London Underground is one of the oldest subway systems in the world.

Dubai, UAE is the newest major city among these five. It's smaller than the others, but it's growing faster. Dubai has the tallest building in the world, the Burj Khalifa. The city is hotter than all the others, with summer temperatures often exceeding 40°C (104°F).

Each city has its own charm. Which one do you think is the best?
